perturbation.original_text: This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the ("Agreement") is entered into on January 11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as "Client") and Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as "Company").
perturbation.changed_text: This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the ("Agreement") is entered into on January 11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as "Client") and Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as "Vendor").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Company' is replaced with 'Vendor' without clarifying if they are the same entity. This creates confusion about which entity is bound by the obligations assigned to 'Company' throughout the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 1. Website Design and Development. Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. Website Design and Development. Client agrees to pay to Vendor the sum of $5,000 (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Company' has been replaced with 'Vendor' which creates an inconsistency because the original definition clause only defined 'Client' and 'Company' thus causing uncertainty on whether 'Vendor' and 'Company' are interchangeable.

perturbation.original_text: 4. Customer Service. Company, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide customer service (the "Customer Service") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth. Company is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Customer Service. Vendor, either directly or through its authorized service provider, shall provide customer service (the "Customer Service") relating to Client Website consisting of replying to customer questions or complaints regarding website hosting services during the normal business hours set forth. Supplier is not obligated to provide any Customer Service except as specified in this Section. Vendor at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Vendor.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Company' is changed to 'Vendor' and 'Vendor' is subsequently changed to 'Supplier' in the second sentence. Since 'Supplier' is not defined in the definitions section, it is unclear if 'Supplier' is same as 'Vendor' or a different entity, thus creating a contradiction.
